summary: In the script book, aziraphale's response to "Quite extraordinary amounts of alcohol." Is "Is that wise? I suppose it is. But...
body: In the script book, aziraphale’s response to “Quite extraordinary amounts of alcohol.” Is “Is that wise? I suppose it is. But let’s have it back at my place.” Which is a) just a cute interaction/line but also b) SO FUNNY because like…… this bitch KNEW they were going to spend hours getting too messy and totally blitzed to be out in public

reblog.comment: In the script book, aziraphale’s response to “Quite extraordinary amounts of alcohol.” Is “Is that wise? I suppose it is. blog.name: garland-on-thy-brow
blog.title: the brooding drummer who steals fans' hearts
blog.description:
Gene | lesbian | 23 | they/them, she/her, occasionally he/him.

Main topic: Late Roman Republic and its interpretations in fiction. Won't shut up about the portrait of Sempronia. Won't shut up about Bridge Theatre Julius Caesar.

Anthony J. Crowley wrote Shakespeare's Julius Caesar. Veva Blanc is alchemical. Symbrock is Brutecass. Killing Eve is EVErything. Rachel Weisz should play Philippa Eilhart.

[AO3]. Tags, about.

summary: But the main storyline is so much more focused in the book. Crowley and Aziraphale just. work together to find the Antichrist,...
body:
But the main storyline is so much more focused in the book. Crowley and Aziraphale just. work together to find the Antichrist, uninterrupted by relationship crises, breakups, plans to fuck off to Alpha Centauri… and honestly, their relationship in the book seemed to me more harmonious, like they were on the same page, instead of Crowley reaching out again and again and Aziraphale taking a step back?

And when in the show Crowley leaves the burning bookshop, puts on new sunglasses - and then we see him sitting somewhere drinking? That’s… not how I remember it at all!

blog.name: only-good-omens
blog.title: I Always Have An Angel And A Demon Looking Over Me
blog.description:
The name is not always correct, this blog is not for exclusively Good Omens, though, I will post about it an awful lot!

Shara/Shar/Sunshine Jim/Sunshine|She/Her|Pan|Hungarian (but lives in England)

Please let me know if you want anything tagged!

Always read my tags.

This is a place for whatever I feel like posting about. It’ll mostly be full of whatever is listed under my ‘Current Obsession(s)’ part bellow but it literally can be anything.

Current obsession(s): GOOD OMENS, Taskmaster, Rocky Horror (Picture) Show, The Mighty Boosh, Noel Fielding, Julian Barratt (basically anything related to those two, really), The Grand Tour (Yes, the game is shit, I know)

Otter tag: Otters are my fave

summary: Request time (if you don't mind)! How about Aziraphale not noticing a shy reader really liking him, she's always in the bookshop...
question: Request time (if you don't mind)! How about Aziraphale not noticing a shy reader really liking him, she's always in the bookshop so Crowley has to spell it out to him? Please and thank you!
answer:
Hey there Nonnie! Thank you so much for the request I really hope you like it! It rurned our to be an awful lot longer than I was planning it to be, but goddamn, it was so much fun to write! I apologise for any typos or slight inconsistencies, it’s currently half past 12am where I live but I really want to get this done heheheh so, enjoy!

The relentless pattering of rain on commuters’ umbrellas is all that surrounds you. Footsteps falling harshly and splashing loudly in puddles on the pavement is just adding to the already cacophonous and gloomy Monday morning.

And yet, you’re smiling as you weave your way through the wet streets with quiet determination, down the path you know so well and take every couple of days. Who are you kidding, on most days.

Clinging onto your umbrella, you stop at a set of traffic lights, adjusting the strap of your backpack slightly with your other hand as you’re now, the only thing standing between you and the bookshop, is a road.

You think back at the first time you stumbled upon this little shop. Seems like forever ago, really, when it has only been a few months in reality.

It has a simple shop front with a charming sign above it reading ‘A. Z. Fell and Co.’. But as you stepped inside was when it really came to be the place you loved. Wall to wall shelves that are just covered in hundreds, maybe even thousands of books. Mostly first editions of anything you could think of, most signed, some even hand written. With dog eared pages as worn out leather covers, you couldn’t help but smile as you breathed in the air of the cozy shop.

When you were greeted by gentle shop keeper, that’s when your world turned. He seemed to literally light up the room. It almost felt as if he was the source of the coziness of the whole shop, as you couldn’t help but blush as his grey orbs met yours and he gently extended a hand introducing himself. “Can I help with anything?” He asked softly and you could have been knocked over by a feather as the softly spoken words have floated out of his mouth.

You quickly muttered that you’ll be fine and grabbed a random book of the self closest to you, hurriedly sitting in the furthest possible corner.

Your next visit was only a few days later. He greeted you, ever so sweetly, and you nodded at him, acknowledging his words as you, again, hurried off to your corner.

The visits every few days would become every couple of days and you’d slowly work your courage up to actually talk to the poor book keeper that you haven’t even introduced yourself to yet.

That day, you sighed heavily before walking into the shop, mentally preparing yourself as to not stumble over your own tongue at the blonde haired sweetheart’s first word.

Yet again, he greeted you softly. This time, it was your turn to extend your hand in a handshake. “Mr Fell..” “Oh, just Aziraphale is fine!” He chuckled. You cursed yourself for finding that so adorable. But after clearing your throat, you continue. “Aziraphale.. I’d like to apologise for the way I have been acting in the past few weeks, I can get a bit… overwhelmed in such sweet- I mean, such nice company.” You stumble a little at getting your words out but he just smiles and softly takes your hand shaking it lightly.

You can tell this is all he works with, books. His hands are soft to the touch and at a closer glance his nails are perfect manicured too, not a single chip in them. You blush slightly at getting lost in the details again.

“That’s quite okay, my dear!” You can hear the smile in his words. “Can I help with anything?”

The sudden beeping of the traffic lights bring you back to the now as you can now see it is safe to cross. And you do so quickly, almost breaking down the doors of the book shop as you stumble in.

~~~~~~~~~~

“Angel, how can someone so intelligent be so stupid?” The demon growls at his counter part, pacing the small space in front of the angel’s desk. “All the signs are there!”

“What do you mean all the signs are there? I sure don’t see them.” The angel, called Aziraphale. is just finishing up his new list of books that are currently present in his shop.

“Mate.” The demon, called Crowley, sighs, pinching the bridge of his nose in frustration. He leans on the table with both hands. “The way she shied away the first time you saw her. She’s always so.. bubbly when she’s in here. Hell, she’s always in here. That should be enough of a five away. You never get customers. She must clearly like you.”

The angel is still not convinced.

“D’you know what, ask her out for a coffee? How about that? A nice coffee. Not a date by any means, unless she wants to make it to be.” He grins, a devilish grin the Aziraphale rarely sees.

Before he could reply, the doors fly open.

The person in question almost falls into the shop. As you gather yourself up, so does the man by Aziraphale’s desk, slowly slithering towards the door.

“Morning.” The word almost sounds like a hiss. He soon disappears around the corner outside. He doesn’t seem to get wet even though it is chucking it down.

“Who’s that?” The question escapes your lips without even meaning to.

“An old.. Friend.” He smiles softly.

You can feel your cheeks heat up as his gaze softly focuses on you. “I was wondering, did you want to get a coffee sometime? You seem to have a refined taste in books, I’d love to get to know a fellow bibliophile better.” He smiles, even wider as you curtly nod, probably far too quickly.

“Right then…” He stands from his desk. “What are we reading today?”

Hope you’ve enjoyed :3

Yet again, he greeted you softly. This time, it was your turn to extend your hand in a handshake. “Mr Fell..” “Oh, just Aziraphale is fine!” He chuckled. You cursed yourself for finding that so adorable. But after clearing your throat, you continue. “Aziraphale.. I’d like to apologise for the way I have been acting in the past few weeks, I can get a bit… overwhelmed in such sweet- I mean, such nice company.” You stumble a little at getting your words out but he just smiles and softly takes your hand shaking it lightly.

You can tell this is all he works with, books. His hands are soft to the touch and at a closer glance his nails are perfect manicured too, not a single chip in them. You blush slightly at getting lost in the details again.

“That’s quite okay, my dear!” You can hear the smile in his words. “Can I help with anything?”

The sudden beeping of the traffic lights bring you back to the now as you can now see it is safe to cross. And you do so quickly, almost breaking down the doors of the book shop as you stumble in.

~~~~~~~~~~

“Angel, how can someone so intelligent be so stupid?” The demon growls at his counter part, pacing the small space in front of the angel’s desk. “All the signs are there!”

“What do you mean all the signs are there? I sure don’t see them.” The angel, called Aziraphale. is just finishing up his new list of books that are currently present in his shop.

“Mate.” The demon, called Crowley, sighs, pinching the bridge of his nose in frustration. He leans on the table with both hands. “The way she shied away the first time you saw her. She’s always so.. bubbly when she’s in here. Hell, she’s always in here. That should be enough of a five away. You never get customers. She must clearly like you.”

The angel is still not convinced.

“D’you know what, ask her out for a coffee? How about that? A nice coffee. Not a date by any means, unless she wants to make it to be.” He grins, a devilish grin the Aziraphale rarely sees.

Before he could reply, the doors fly open.

The person in question almost falls into the shop. As you gather yourself up, so does the man by Aziraphale’s desk, slowly slithering towards the door.

“Morning.” The word almost sounds like a hiss. He soon disappears around the corner outside. He doesn’t seem to get wet even though it is chucking it down.

“Who’s that?” The question escapes your lips without even meaning to.

“An old.. Friend.” He smiles softly.

You can feel your cheeks heat up as his gaze softly focuses on you. “I was wondering, did you want to get a coffee sometime? You seem to have a refined taste in books, I’d love to get to know a fellow bibliophile better.” He smiles, even wider as you curtly nod, probably far too quickly.

“Right then…” He stands from his desk. “What are we reading today?”

Hope you’ve enjoyed :3
trail.content:
Hey there Nonnie! Thank you so much for the request I really hope you like it! It rurned our to be an awful lot longer than I was planning it to be, but goddamn, it was so much fun to write! I apologise for any typos or slight inconsistencies, it’s currently half past 12am where I live but I really want to get this done heheheh so, enjoy!

The relentless pattering of rain on commuters’ umbrellas is all that surrounds you. Footsteps falling harshly and splashing loudly in puddles on the pavement is just adding to the already cacophonous and gloomy Monday morning.

And yet, you’re smiling as you weave your way through the wet streets with quiet determination, down the path you know so well and take every couple of days. Who are you kidding, on most days.

Clinging onto your umbrella, you stop at a set of traffic lights, adjusting the strap of your backpack slightly with your other hand as you’re now, the only thing standing between you and the bookshop, is a road.

You think back at the first time you stumbled upon this little shop. Seems like forever ago, really, when it has only been a few months in reality.

It has a simple shop front with a charming sign above it reading ‘A. Z. Fell and Co.’. But as you stepped inside was when it really came to be the place you loved. Wall to wall shelves that are just covered in hundreds, maybe even thousands of books. Mostly first editions of anything you could think of, most signed, some even hand written. With dog eared pages as worn out leather covers, you couldn’t help but smile as you breathed in the air of the cozy shop.

When you were greeted by gentle shop keeper, that’s when your world turned. He seemed to literally light up the room. It almost felt as if he was the source of the coziness of the whole shop, as you couldn’t help but blush as his grey orbs met yours and he gently extended a hand introducing himself. “Can I help with anything?” He asked softly and you could have been knocked over by a feather as the softly spoken words have floated out of his mouth.

You quickly muttered that you’ll be fine and grabbed a random book of the self closest to you, hurriedly sitting in the furthest possible corner.

Your next visit was only a few days later. He greeted you, ever so sweetly, and you nodded at him, acknowledging his words as you, again, hurried off to your corner.

The visits every few days would become every couple of days and you’d slowly work your courage up to actually talk to the poor book keeper that you haven’t even introduced yourself to yet.

That day, you sighed heavily before walking into the shop, mentally preparing yourself as to not stumble over your own tongue at the blonde haired sweetheart’s first word.

Yet again, he greeted you softly. This time, it was your turn to extend your hand in a handshake. “Mr Fell..” “Oh, just Aziraphale is fine!” He chuckled. You cursed yourself for finding that so adorable. But after clearing your throat, you continue. “Aziraphale.. I’d like to apologise for the way I have been acting in the past few weeks, I can get a bit… overwhelmed in such sweet- I mean, such nice company.” You stumble a little at getting your words out but he just smiles and softly takes your hand shaking it lightly.

You can tell this is all he works with, books. His hands are soft to the touch and at a closer glance his nails are perfect manicured too, not a single chip in them. You blush slightly at getting lost in the details again.

“That’s quite okay, my dear!” You can hear the smile in his words. “Can I help with anything?”

The sudden beeping of the traffic lights bring you back to the now as you can now see it is safe to cross. And you do so quickly, almost breaking down the doors of the book shop as you stumble in.

~~~~~~~~~~

“Angel, how can someone so intelligent be so stupid?” The demon growls at his counter part, pacing the small space in front of the angel’s desk. “All the signs are there!”

“What do you mean all the signs are there? I sure don’t see them.” The angel, called Aziraphale. is just finishing up his new list of books that are currently present in his shop.

“Mate.” The demon, called Crowley, sighs, pinching the bridge of his nose in frustration. He leans on the table with both hands. “The way she shied away the first time you saw her. She’s always so.. bubbly when she’s in here. Hell, she’s always in here. That should be enough of a five away. You never get customers. She must clearly like you.”

The angel is still not convinced.

“D’you know what, ask her out for a coffee? How about that? A nice coffee. Not a date by any means, unless she wants to make it to be.” He grins, a devilish grin the Aziraphale rarely sees.

Before he could reply, the doors fly open.

The person in question almost falls into the shop. As you gather yourself up, so does the man by Aziraphale’s desk, slowly slithering towards the door.

“Morning.” The word almost sounds like a hiss. He soon disappears around the corner outside. He doesn’t seem to get wet even though it is chucking it down.

“Who’s that?” The question escapes your lips without even meaning to.

“An old.. Friend.” He smiles softly.

You can feel your cheeks heat up as his gaze softly focuses on you. “I was wondering, did you want to get a coffee sometime? You seem to have a refined taste in books, I’d love to get to know a fellow bibliophile better.” He smiles, even wider as you curtly nod, probably far too quickly.

“Right then…” He stands from his desk. “What are we reading today?”

Hope you’ve enjoyed :3

blog.name: thesnarkbait
blog.description: Sci-fi, tv, mainly Netflix shows. As well as other things.

summary: I liked that Gabriel was played by an American because after hundreds of American productions where every angel and/or...
body:
I liked that Gabriel was played by an American because after hundreds of American productions where every angel and/or historical person for some inexplicable reason speaks British English, the Americans have officially conditioned me to see Gabriel as an annoying business executive managing his stupid employees, more than a holy angel with great purpose.

Which is probably the feeling they were going for.
